data.event: The county, founded in 1800, is named for Colonel John Floyd (1750â€“1783).

event.title: December 13, 1799, the Kentucky General Assembly passed

data.event: On December 13, 1799, the Kentucky General Assembly passed legislation to form Floyd County as the 40th county of Kentucky.
The legislation became effective on June 1, 1800.
The first court house burned down on April 8, 1808, destroying all the early records, so the earliest records of government activity do not date prior to 1808.

event.title: took place nearby, the Battle of Ivy Mountain on November 8, 1861

data.event: Prestonsburg was used as a Confederate stronghold during the Civil War and two battles took place nearby, the Battle of Ivy Mountain on November 8, 1861 and the Battle of Middle Creek on January 10, 1862.
